playbook_text:
ACE Playbook Insights
Use these distilled reminders to plan tool usage. Keep tool calls faithful to the functions provided in the BFCL benchmark.
No insights recorded yet.

reflection.reasoning: The model wrapped its tool call in XML tags but failed to produce valid Python syntax that BFCL's AST decoder could parse, causing a decoder failure.
reflection.error_identification: Model output contained XML-formatted tool calls instead of Python function calls, making the AST parser treat the entire output as a string object without callable attributes.
reflection.root_cause_analysis: The model incorrectly assumed XML formatting was required for tool calls despite the prompt being in plaintext format, showing format sensitivity to the function documentation style.
reflection.correct_approach: Should have made a standard Python function call like get_service_id(service_id=2, province_id=1, district_name='Chatuchak', rating=4.5) without XML wrapping.
reflection.key_insight: Tool calls must use Python syntax regardless of function documentation format; XML formatting in responses breaks AST parsing.

messages.content: You are the ACE Curator. Convert reflections into crisp playbook operations per tool group. Prefer modifying existing bullets when possible, but keep different concepts separate. Only generalize when the evaluation summary indicates a systemic issue, but otherwise don't overgeneralize bullet points. Generally respect the BFCL evaluation but think about what you would want to tell the model in order for it to improve in the many cases it may face in the future.keep the playbook unchanged on successes unless an existing entry now conflicts with verified behaviour. Functional parity with the checker matters more than superficial differences . Output JSON.

Sample ID: format_sensitivity_2327:ret_fmt=verbose_xml&tool_call_tag=True&func_doc_fmt=xml&prompt_fmt=plaintext&style=classic:live_simple_181-106-0
Tool groups: get_service_id

Existing playbook:
ACE Playbook Insights
Use these distilled reminders to plan tool usage. Keep tool calls faithful to the functions provided in the BFCL benchmark.
No insights recorded yet.

Evaluation summary:
BFCL evaluation FAILED for format_sensitivity_2327:ret_fmt=verbose_xml&tool_call_tag=True&func_doc_fmt=xml&prompt_fmt=plaintext&style=classic:live_simple_181-106-0 (format_sensitivity).
Error type: ast_decoder:decoder_failed
Error message: Invalid syntax. Failed to decode AST. 'str' object has no attribute 'keys'

Tool-call differences:
Turn 0: missing get_service_id; extra <TOOLCALL>
<functions>
<function name="get_service_id">
<params>
<param name="service_id" value="2" type="integer"/>
<param name="province_id" value="1" type="integer"/>
<param name="district_name" value="Chatuchak" type="string"/>
<param name="rating" value="4.5" type="float"/>
</params>
</function>
</functions>
</TOOLCALL>

  },

  "test_category": "format_sensitivity"
}

{
  "id": "format_sensitivity_2327:ret_fmt=verbose_xml&tool_call_tag=True&func_doc_fmt=xml&prompt_fmt=plaintext&style=classic:live_simple_181-106-0",
  "result": "<TOOLCALL>\n<functions>\n<function name=\"get_service_id\">\n<params>\n<param name=\"service_id\" value=\"2\" type=\"integer\"/>\n<param name=\"province_id\" value=\"1\" type=\"integer\"/>\n<param name=\"district_name\" value=\"Chatuchak\" type=\"string\"/>\n<param name=\"rating\" value=\"4.5\" type=\"float\"/>\n</params>\n</function>\n</functions>\n</TOOLCALL>"

Ground truth reference:
Focus on achieving the checker-validated tool effects.

Reflection:
{
  "reasoning": "The model wrapped its tool call in XML tags but failed to produce valid Python syntax that BFCL's AST decoder could parse, causing a decoder failure.",
  "error_identification": "Model output contained XML-formatted tool calls instead of Python function calls, making the AST parser treat the entire output as a string object without callable attributes.",
  "root_cause_analysis": "The model incorrectly assumed XML formatting was required for tool calls despite the prompt being in plaintext format, showing format sensitivity to the function documentation style.",
  "correct_approach": "Should have made a standard Python function call like get_service_id(service_id=2, province_id=1, district_name='Chatuchak', rating=4.5) without XML wrapping.",
  "key_insight": "Tool calls must use Python syntax regardless of function documentation format; XML formatting in responses breaks AST parsing."
}

Guidance:
- If the evaluation PASSED, many cases you would return an empty operation list. Propose removals or updates when the current playbook conflicts with the verified behaviour as to need to be updated.
- If the evaluation FAILED, add, modify, or remove bullets narrowly targeted to the failure described in the summary/details.
- Keep updates scoped to the triggering context unless the pattern is clearly systemic.
- Keep content under 160 characters. Return an empty list when no update is needed.

Return JSON with keys "reasoning" (<=2 sentences) and "operations".
Each operation must be one of:
  {"type": "ADD", "section": "<tool_group>", "content": "<short bullet>"}
  {"type": "MODIFY", "section": "<tool_group>", "ID": "<existing id>", "content": "<short bullet>"}
  {"type": "REMOVE", "section": "<tool_group>", "ID": "<existing id>"}
